Slovakia won 1-0 against Belgium.
Romelu Lukaku had two goals ruled out by VAR.

Johan Bakayoko had a shot cleared off the line.
VAR ruled out 2 goals by Romelu Lukaku for Belgium.
Slovakia held on to claim a 1-0 victory over Belgium.
Two Romelu Lukaku goals were ruled out by video review.
Ivan Schranz scored for Slovakia in the seventh minute.
Loïs Openda had a goal disallowed by VAR for a handball.
Ivan Schranz’s early goal was enough to snaffle the points.
Romelu Lukaku's goal was ruled out for offside in the 56th minute.
Slovakia struck with a seventh-minute goal by forward Ivan Schranz.
Slovakia struck in the seventh minute through forward Ivan Schranz.
Koen Casteels made a superb diving save from Lukás Haraslín's volley.
Belgium fell to a first loss in 15 games under coach Domenico Tedesco.
Romelu Lukaku had a shot saved by Martin Dubravka in the third minute.
Defender Dávid Hancko's brave goal-line block preserved Slovakia's win.
Jérémy Doku lost possession in his own area, leading to Slovakia's goal.

Slovakia defender Dávid Hancko cleared a shot off the line from Johan Bakayoko.

Slovakia delivered the first major shock result of Euro 2024 by defeating Belgium 1-0.
Lukaku's second goal was disallowed by VAR for a handball by Loïs Openda in the 86th minute.
A performance of discipline, aggression and intensity gave Slovakia a shock win over Belgium.
Slovakia defended well, recording their biggest win since beating Italy in the 2010 World Cup.
Slovakia goalkeeper Martin Dúbravka made a crucial save from Romelu Lukaku's point-blank shot.

Ivan Schranz took advantage of a horror defensive error to put Slovakia ahead in the seventh minute.

Romelu Lukaku had two goals chalked out by VAR as Belgium slumped to a 1-0 defeat against Slovakia at Euro 2024.
Belgium's Romelu Lukaku had two second-half goals overturned after being initially given by the match officials.
Slovakia took an early lead courtesy of Ivan Schranz after Jeremy Doku gave away the ball near his own penalty area.
The second VAR intervention in the 86th minute judged that Loïs Openda handled the ball before his decisive pass to Lukaku.
Though Belgium were a little better in the second half, especially once Lois Openda came on, Romelu Lukaku had two strikes disallowed by VAR.
Romelu Lukaku had two goals ruled out by VAR, first for offside in the 56th minute and then for a handball in the build-up in the 86th minute.
Lukaku thought he had equalised in the second half twice, but technology intervened to deny him, once for offside and once for a handball in the build-up.
Belgium started the game well with Jeremy Doku to the fore, but then on seven minutes, he passed the ball across his own box and it was intercepted, leading to Slovakia's goal.
